bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Chester S. Keefer, June 10, 1948

div1.p: Hench appreciates Keefer's compliments on his article. He informs Keefer that the Cuban government has set aside funds to memorialize Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Chester S. Keefer, June 10, 1948
div1.opener:
June 10, 1948
Dr. Chester S. Keefer
Evans Memorial Hospital
65 East Newton Street
Boston 18, Massachusetts
My dear Chester:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for your nice words
about my little article in the Pharos. I gave the
talk, illustrated, at the University of Virginia. They
had asked for a pre-meeting copy for local publicity and
the Alumni Bulletin. I didn't know it was to be published
in Pharos until I received proof and had to make a few
hasty last-minute corrections. Anyhow, my experiences
with this little venture have been very interesting and
amusing.

I might tell you that the Cuban Government
has at last set aside $50,000 to memorialize Camp
Lazear and they approved the preliminary plans that
I drew up for a little memorial.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
